mechanics.outcome: A 20-foot cube of webs fills the area for the duration

mechanics.condition: Creature is in the area of webs

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to see through webs
mechanics.condition: Creature is attempting to see through webs

mechanics.trigger: Start of your next turn after casting
mechanics.condition: Webs are NOT anchored between two solid masses OR NOT layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling
mechanics.outcome: Conjured web collapses and spell ends

mechanics.trigger: Webs layered over a flat surface
mechanics.condition: Webs are layered over a flat surface
mechanics.outcome: Webs have a depth of 5 feet

mechanics.trigger: Creature starts its turn in the webs OR enters them during its turn
mechanics.condition: Creature fails a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC
mechanics.outcome: Creature is restrained as long as it remains in the webs

mechanics.trigger: Creature takes an Action while restrained by webs
mechanics.condition: Creature succeeds on a Strength check against your spell save DC

mechanics.trigger: Any 5-foot cube of webs is exposed to fire
mechanics.outcome: That 5-foot cube of webs burns away in 1 round

mechanics.trigger: Creature starts its turn in burning webs
mechanics.condition: Creature is in a 5-foot cube of webs that is burning

description_text: You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range. The webs fill a 20-foot cube from that point for the duration. The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure their area.If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the conjured web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.Each creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is restrained as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free.A creature restrained by the webs can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer restrained.The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing 2d4 fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.
